lead_paragraph: The Miami Hurricanes football team played its first game at the Orange Bowl in 1937, but after this season the team will have a new home. The Hurricanes will play at Dolphin Stadium starting in 2008, leaving the historic but decaying Orange Bowl. University trustees voted to make the move yesterday, despite an offer of $206 million by city officials to renovate the Orange Bowl. Miami agreed to a 25-year lease and could collect more than $2 million in additional revenue each year compared with the Orange Bowl.
